intro: Erigeron wislizeni, commonly known as blueweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its blue to purple flowers bloom in summer, and it has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. Erigeron wislizeni is often used in native plant gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
